comments:
N20031201:
- extract build into a directory with an underscore ("_") in its name
- try to launch eclipse.exe -consolelog
-> SplashScreen freezes, cmdline output below, no clue as to why the thing
failed. We had the same effect when trying to start a run-time workbench where
the workspace directory contained an underscore.

This is a severe bug which cost us hours. The problem is probably in
EclipseStarter.java, line 133, where the strange catch clause starts with
"... location.indexOf('_');"
The intention was probably "... .lastIndexOf('_')".

Fix seems reasonable.  Pascal please verify and release for tomorrow.

Sorry can not reproduce. I even tried installing it in the same folder than you.
Which VM are you using?

I'm using Sun's JDK 1.4.2. I don't specify a -vm argument since my java.exe is
on the %PATH%.

Now, I can't reproduce the failure with my instructions either. I think the
problem is another one: The installation directory can't be renamed after an
initial run of eclipse.

- extract N20031201
- run eclipse -consolelog
- exit eclipse
- rename the directory "eclipse" to "eclipse_X"
- run eclipse -consolelog
-> now I get the exceptions again

Although there is no PR for this, it is a wellknown problem and is in our list 
of things. 
Reducing the severity and changing title.

Commited a fix to delete .bundledata and .framework on startup when the install 
location changed. 
Need to verifiy if the .state file needs to be deleted too.

Pascal, I did what you suggested: the state location gets deleted as well. Since
the state manager hasn't been created yet, seems to be the best/simplest thing
to do.

Note for history.

The location has not been deleted from the .bundledata nor from the .state.

It is absolutely necessary to keep it in the .bundledata case since it is the 
guy who knows where to find things and it cannot be relative since this file is 
saved in the config area which can be located anywhere.

For the state, the location information is necessary when the state is commited.

Mark as fixed.
I could reproduce the problem. Released Markus' suggested fix.
*** Bug 47991 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
